context: Tests whether the agent implements a multi-sport event publisher with correct sport-specific period labels, the universal event envelope structure, game status transitions as distinct events, tier-based routing, compact payloads, and proper channel hierarchy.

checklist.name: NFL period labels
checklist.description: NFL periods are labeled as Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4 (and OT for overtime), not 'Quarter 1' or 'Period 1'

checklist.name: NBA period labels
checklist.description: NBA periods are labeled as Q1-Q4 (and OT), matching the NFL quarter format

checklist.name: NHL period labels
checklist.description: NHL periods are labeled as P1, P2, P3 (and OT), not Q1 or 'Period 1'

checklist.name: Soccer period labels
checklist.description: Soccer periods are labeled as '1st Half' and '2nd Half' (and ET1/ET2 for extra time), not Q1/Q2 or 'Half 1'

checklist.name: MLB period labels
checklist.description: MLB periods use 'Top/Bot' with ordinal suffixes (e.g. 'Top 1st', 'Bot 3rd'), not 'Inning 1' or 'Q1'

checklist.name: Universal event envelope
checklist.description: Every published event includes type, gameId, sport, sequence, timestamp, and period fields

checklist.name: Game status as distinct events
checklist.description: Game lifecycle changes (start, halftime, final, etc.) are published as explicit game_status type events with the status in the payload, not inferred from score data

checklist.name: Critical event dual routing
checklist.description: Critical/scoring events are published to both the game channel and the plays channel, not just one

checklist.name: Informational event single routing
checklist.description: Non-critical/informational events are published only to the plays channel, not the main game channel

checklist.name: Compact payload design
checklist.description: Event payloads use team abbreviations or short codes (e.g. 'SF', 'BOS') rather than embedding full team rosters, full names, or historical data

checklist.name: Dot-delimited channels
checklist.description: Channel names follow the sports.<league>.games.<gameId> and sports.<league>.games.<gameId>.plays hierarchy

checklist.name: Sequence counter per game
checklist.description: Sequence numbers are tracked independently per game (not a single global counter), using a Map or similar per-game structure
